author: John Cross
title: Watford stars want demanding Walter Mazzarri to make training less tough after 1 win in 8 games
text:
Sport Watford stars want demanding Walter Mazzarri to make training less tough after 1 win in 8 games Burnout is becoming an issue as the Italian's squad are pushed so hard between matches they feel jaded come kickoff Share Watford are short-handed because of injuries so there's little chance to rest anyone (Photo: Getty) Share Get     
Watford players fear burnout over their boss Walter Mazzarri’s brutal training regime. 
The out-of-form Hornets have sunk down the Premier League table after a run of just one win in eight games, losing again at Stoke on Tuesday night, leaving them facing a fight against relegation. 
Mazzarri must now be concerned for his own future at a club notorious for hiring and firing managers, although the former Napoli and Inter coach insists he does not fear the sack . 
But there is a worry within the squad about their form and fitness levels and anxiety is growing about their slump. Mazzarri asks a lot of his players and doesn't allow them many rest days (Photo: Getty) 
The Hornets are in the middle of an injury crisis on the back of a gruelling run of fixtures and training programme. 
Italian Mazzarri is known as a tough taskmaster and pushes his squad hard in training. 
They have also been given few rest days and many players have been left feeling jaded — which is there for all to see in their recent match-day performances. 
Watford still look safe of immediate danger, but the players would prefer lighter sessions to try to keep them fresh for games. Watford conceded four goals at home to Tottenham on Sunday... (Photo: Getty) ...and went down 2-0 at Stoke barely 48 hours later (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Mazzarri could take the chance to rest some of his squad for Saturday's FA Cup third-round tie at home to Championship strugglers Burton. 
But unless they can arrest the alarming trend, Watford could get sucked into real danger. Like us on Facebook
